title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist
description: Under certain circumstances, code assist eats too much code. Consider the enclosed class. As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.
OB: The code is changed to: baz(x.foo().foo()) I would rather it gave me baz(x.foo(), x.foo())
EB: The expected behavior is that code assist should suggest the correct syntax for the baz call in bar and replace the code appropriately.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Change the baz call to baz(x.x.foo()) 2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.' 3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist 4. Type 'f' to filter the list 5. Select 'foo()' from the suggested options.
